qas.question: The true diversity within the insect species remains what?
How many insect species are estimated to exist?
How many new species of all organisms are discovered each year?
Of all the species on earth, how much do insects make up?
For many years to come, most insect species will remain as what?

context: Though the true dimensions of species diversity remain <a0_0>uncertain<a0_0/>, estimates range from <a1_0>2.6–7.8 million species<a1_0/> with a mean of 5.5 million. This probably represents <a3_0>less than 20%<a3_0/> of all species on Earth[citation needed], and with only about <a2_0>20,000<a2_0/> new species of all organisms being described each year, most species likely will remain <a4_0>undescribed<a4_0/> for many years unless species descriptions increase in rate. About 850,000–1,000,000 of all described species are insects. Of the 24 orders of insects, four dominate in terms of numbers of described species, with at least 3 million species included in Coleoptera, Diptera, Hymenoptera and Lepidoptera. A recent study estimated the number of beetles at 0.9–2.1 million with a mean of 1.5 million.
